articles.headline: Should You Get a Divorce Now or Later?
articles.snippet: The new tax law may determine whether it’s better to complete a divorce by Dec. 31 or wait until next year.
articles.abstract: The new tax law may determine whether it’s better to complete a divorce by Dec. 31 or wait until next year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawyers and accountants often push their clients to plan for unpleasant events. Better to be prepared now than to pay the consequences later. But the Republican tax law that took effect in January has added a new urgency for wealthy Americans contemplating divorce.

articles.headline: Les Moonves, CBS Chief, Faces Inquiry Over Misconduct Allegations
articles.snippet: The company’s board said it would investigate allegations of sexual harassment against Mr. Moonves that were detailed in a New Yorker article.
articles.abstract: The company’s board said it would investigate allegations of sexual harassment against Mr. Moonves that were detailed in a New Yorker article.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leslie Moonves, the chief executive of the CBS Corporation and one of the most powerful people in the media business, is facing an investigation after a report published on Friday revealed allegations of sexual harassment made against him by six women.

articles.headline: ‘They Spit When I Walked in the Street’: The ‘New Anti-Semitism’ in France
articles.snippet: A strong correlation has been observed between increases in hate crimes against French Jews and the conflict between Israel and the Palestinians.
articles.abstract: A strong correlation has been observed between increases in hate crimes against French Jews and the conflict between Israel and the Palestinians.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The solemn boulevards and quiet side streets of the 17th Arrondissement in Paris suggest Jewish life in France is vibrant: There is a new profusion of kosher groceries and restaurants, and about 15 synagogues, up from only a handful two decades ago.

articles.headline: As Affordable Housing Crisis Grows, HUD Sits on the Sidelines
articles.snippet: Local officials seem resigned to the fact that they will receive little or no help from the Trump administration, whose main policy response has been a plan to increase some rents.
articles.abstract: Local officials seem resigned to the fact that they will receive little or no help from the Trump administration, whose main policy response has been a plan to increase some rents.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The country is in the grips of an escalating housing affordability crisis. Millions of low-income Americans are paying 70 percent or more of their incomes for shelter, while rents continue to rise and construction of affordable rental apartments lags far behind the need.

articles.headline: Sex Scandal Toppled a Silicon Valley Chief. Investors Say, So What?
articles.snippet: Mike Cagney lost his job as chief executive of Social Finance after a board investigation into sexual misconduct. Some of those board members have since funded his next venture.
articles.abstract: Mike Cagney lost his job as chief executive of Social Finance after a board investigation into sexual misconduct. Some of those board members have since funded his next venture.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Last September, the board of the online lending company Social Finance  ousted its chief executive, Mike Cagney, after questions about sexual misconduct.

articles.headline: ‘What Does a Trucker Look Like?’ It’s Changing, Amid a Big Shortage
articles.snippet: Pressured by a strong demand for goods, an industry known for older white men is trying to recruit women, teenagers and people of color.
articles.abstract: Pressured by a strong demand for goods, an industry known for older white men is trying to recruit women, teenagers and people of color.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — America’s booming economy has a problem: a shortage of truck drivers.

articles.headline: In Georgia Governor’s Race, a Defining Moment for a Southern State
articles.snippet: Democrats and Republicans alike believe that when Georgia chooses between Stacey Abrams and Brian Kemp, they will be signaling what the Deep South powerhouse stands for.
articles.abstract: Democrats and Republicans alike believe that when Georgia chooses between Stacey Abrams and Brian Kemp, they will be signaling what the Deep South powerhouse stands for.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — The Republican won the nomination Tuesday after branding himself a politically incorrect conservative who would “round up criminal illegals” and haul them to the border in his very own pickup. The Democrat all but opened her campaign by demanding that the iconic carvings of Jefferson Davis, Robert E. Lee and Stonewall Jackson be sandblasted off Stone Mountain.
articles.byline: By Kevin Sack and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: From a Space Station in Argentina, China Expands Its Reach in Latin America
articles.snippet: Our correspondent went to the deserts of Patagonia to examine how China secured its new base, a symbol of its growing clout in the region.
articles.abstract: Our correspondent went to the deserts of Patagonia to examine how China secured its new base, a symbol of its growing clout in the region.
articles.lead_paragraph: QUINTUCO, Argentina — The giant antenna rises from the desert floor like an apparition, a gleaming metal tower jutting 16 stories above an endless wind-whipped stretch of Patagonia.

articles.headline: Beauty Is in the Eye of These Beholders
articles.snippet: Beautycon is the Super Bowl of the beauty industry, where new products are unveiled and celebrities show up to launch their forays into the lucrative makeup business.
articles.abstract: Beautycon is the Super Bowl of the beauty industry, where new products are unveiled and celebrities show up to launch their forays into the lucrative makeup business.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Thousands of cat-eyed, contoured-cheeked, glitter-doused women — and more than a few painted men — descended on the 347,000-square-foot South Hall of the Los Angeles Convention Center earlier this month, gathering at the makeup mecca that is Beautycon. For two days, as they wandered among more than 200 elaborately festooned booths sponsored by brands like Maybelline and Lime Crime, they searched for samples and stars. Some would be instantly familiar to anyone with a passing knowledge of reality TV (i.e., Kim Kardashian West). Others clearly had a more specialized fan base. (Nikita Dragun, anyone? How about Gigi Gorgeous or Manny MUA?)

articles.headline: Would You Pay $1 Billion for This View?
articles.snippet: A 157-acre hilltop plot in Los Angeles is being pitched as the city’s most expensive residential property ever.
articles.abstract: A 157-acre hilltop plot in Los Angeles is being pitched as the city’s most expensive residential property ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — A property about to go on the market here consists of 157 acres of hilltop land in the coveted Beverly Hills 90210 ZIP code, a 10-minute drive from Rodeo Drive. With its 360-degree views, you can spot many of Los Angeles’s major landmarks in the distance, from Century City to downtown, and even — on a clear day — the Pacific Ocean. There are winding, private roads that lead to big, flat lawns the size of football fields.

articles.headline: Cardinal Theodore McCarrick Resigns Amid Sexual Abuse Scandal
articles.snippet: Pope Francis accepted his letter of resignation and ordered the former archbishop of Washington to remain in seclusion while accusations against him were being examined, the Vatican said.
articles.abstract: Pope Francis accepted his letter of resignation and ordered the former archbishop of Washington to remain in seclusion while accusations against him were being examined, the Vatican said.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROME — Pope Francis has accepted the resignation of Cardinal Theodore E. McCarrick, the former archbishop of Washington, from the College of Cardinals, ordering him to a “life of prayer and penance” after allegations that the cardinal sexually abused minors and adult seminarians over the course of decades, the Vatican announced on Saturday.
articles.byline: By Elisabetta Povoledo and Sharon Otterman

articles.headline: Newest U.S. Strategy in Afghanistan Mirrors Past Plans for Retreat
articles.snippet: The Trump administration is pushing Afghan commanders to surrender rural and sparsely populated areas of the country and focus on protecting cities.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration is pushing Afghan commanders to surrender rural and sparsely populated areas of the country and focus on protecting cities.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration is urging American-backed Afghan troops to retreat from sparsely populated areas of the country, officials said, all but ensuring the Taliban will remain in control of vast stretches of the country.
articles.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: Still Standing, Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump Step Back in the Spotlight
articles.snippet: They have waited out, and in some cases ground down, their critics, and are ready to make a more visible push for their projects.
articles.abstract: They have waited out, and in some cases ground down, their critics, and are ready to make a more visible push for their projects.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — They disappointed climate change activists who thought they would keep President Trump from leaving the landmark Paris accord. They enraged Democrats and even some Republicans by not pushing back against his immigration policies, and alienated business allies by their silence over threats to Nafta. They regularly faced news stories about their unpopularity.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Katie Rogers

articles.headline: Cynthia Nixon Thinks You’re Underestimating Her
articles.snippet: The actress-turned-candidate for governor is trying to persuade skeptical New York Democrats to see beyond her political inexperience, as some did with Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.
articles.abstract: The actress-turned-candidate for governor is trying to persuade skeptical New York Democrats to see beyond her political inexperience, as some did with Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even then, no one was quite sure what to make of Cynthia Nixon.

articles.headline: ‘Lopping,’ ‘Tips’ and the ‘Z-List’: Bias Lawsuit Explores Harvard’s Admissions Secrets
articles.snippet: The suit, which accuses the university of discriminating against Asian-Americans, has shed light on little-known aspects of Harvard’s selection process.
articles.abstract: The suit, which accuses the university of discriminating against Asian-Americans, has shed light on little-known aspects of Harvard’s selection process.
articles.lead_paragraph: He had perfect scores — on his SAT, on three SAT subject tests and on nine Advanced Placement exams — and was ranked first in his high school class of 592. An admissions officer who reviewed his application to Harvard called him “the proverbial picket fence,” the embodiment of the American dream, saying, “Someone we’ll fight over w/ Princeton, I’d guess.”
articles.byline: By Anemona Hartocollis, Amy Harmon and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: When Is a Burrito More Than Just a Burrito? When It’s a Lifestyle
articles.snippet: Chipotle is marketing itself as a “purpose-driven lifestyle brand” at a time when brands are trying to enter their customers’ daily lives.
articles.abstract: Chipotle is marketing itself as a “purpose-driven lifestyle brand” at a time when brands are trying to enter their customers’ daily lives.
articles.lead_paragraph: Earlier this summer, Chipotle’s new chief marketing officer outlined a lofty vision for the burrito-and-taco chain and the feelings it could one day evoke in consumers.

articles.headline: Imran Khan, as New Leader, Could Help Pakistan Reshape Its Image
articles.snippet: Pakistan has long been associated with terrorism and dysfunction. Mr. Khan, the presumed new leader, could alter the narrative.
articles.abstract: Pakistan has long been associated with terrorism and dysfunction. Mr. Khan, the presumed new leader, could alter the narrative.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — For a nation often in the news for all the wrong reasons — suicide bombings, horrific school massacres — Pakistan has reached a turning point that could possibly alter its dysfunctional trajectory.

articles.headline: Have a Cryptocurrency Company? Bermuda, Malta or Gibraltar Wants You
articles.snippet: With their eyes on blockchain jobs and revenue, small countries and territories are competing to become the go-to destinations for entrepreneurs and projects.
articles.abstract: With their eyes on blockchain jobs and revenue, small countries and territories are competing to become the go-to destinations for entrepreneurs and projects.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Hedge funds go to the Cayman Islands to incorporate. Big companies are generally domiciled in Delaware. And online poker companies often set up their bases in Gibraltar and Malta.

articles.headline: For Sale: Survey Data on Millions of High School Students
articles.snippet: College-planning surveys give a peek into the opaque and little-regulated market of data-mining of minors.
articles.abstract: College-planning surveys give a peek into the opaque and little-regulated market of data-mining of minors.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOWELL, Mass. — Three thousand high school students from across the United States recently trekked to a university sports arena here to attend an event with an impressive-sounding name: the Congress of Future Science and Technology Leaders. Many of their parents had spent $985 on tuition.

articles.headline: 11 and Married: Malaysia Spars Over an Age-Old Practice
articles.snippet: An 11-year-old girl’s marriage to a 41-year-old man — the father of her best friend — has reignited debate in this modern multiethnic democracy about the persistence of weddings for girls under 18.
articles.abstract: An 11-year-old girl’s marriage to a 41-year-old man — the father of her best friend — has reignited debate in this modern multiethnic democracy about the persistence of weddings for girls under 18.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUA MUSANG, Malaysia — Norazila and Ayu were best friends and they shared everything that girls do: sleepovers, selfies, musings about cute boys.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Faces Another Midterm Threat as Trump Plays the Shutdown Card
articles.snippet: In a tweet, the president said he would be willing to shut down the government if Democrats do not give him money for his border wall.
articles.abstract: In a tweet, the president said he would be willing to shut down the government if Democrats do not give him money for his border wall.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congressional Republicans, already facing a difficult election landscape, confronted a prospect on Sunday they had worked feverishly to avoid: a threat by President Trump to shut down the government over funding for a border wall.
